Articles.Content:
There's a handy "view seamless tiling" feature below each image when you click it as well. The main thing with WIP EVE that bugs me is that the textures aren't just plain tiled. They're flipped and then tiled. Is there a way to prevent this?

You'd have to ask rbray I'm afraid

You'd have to ask rbray I'm afraid

I was the last person to post on his thread and I don't really want to edit that post a second time... I'd have to ask him later

Hm... that might be a cool feature to have in the config file... a line of code where you could specify whether you want a texture layed in a perfect tile, flipped, mirrored, 90/180 degree rotation, or a random rotation... one can dream.

Edited September 10, 2015 by Avera9eJoe

Hey Pete, I was wondering if you have made progress with the Linux64 branch in the past month, and feel like pushing an update to Github RP-0 seems to have fixed its incompatibility with your mod (in Git, not released yet), so soon I'd be able to install RVE again to bask in its beauty...

Pete - thanks for getting back to me - there appear to be NO *.dll files in the EVE_Overhaul/Gamedata/ folder...the /Gamedata/Plugins folder only contains a 'license.txt' file and that's it. So...I guess to answer your question, no, I don't have the EVE *.dll's in Env...Vis...Enhancements folder because it appears as though there are none in the repository? I feel like I'm doing something terribly and simply wrong...

When I go to the EVE github and go do the Overhaul branch and press 't' to look at the all of the files in the repository, there really don't seem to be any *.dll files in there...there are in the master, but I don't seem to be seeing any in the Overhaul.

Thanks again and appreciate the help!!! You do tremendous work!

You gotta get the x86 release zip from the overhaul branch, it's not in one of the folders on github

Hey Pete, I was wondering if you have made progress with the Linux64 branch in the past month, and feel like pushing an update to Github RP-0 seems to have fixed its incompatibility with your mod (in Git, not released yet), so soon I'd be able to install RVE again to bask in its beauty...

If you want R-P0 with RVE, you can go to the commit and apply the changes to the areas Nathan did to the contracts, but make sure you have Notepad++ it will make it a ton of easier.

Hey, I have installed RVE 1.0.4 experimental to a standard CKAN RSS install, using only the Environmental Visual Enhancements plugins provided, the RVE folder itself (no Boulderco) folder and I get a strange atmosphere glitch around Earth...

I have deduced this to be an RVE problem since it does not occur without the RVE folder. I followed installation instructions to the letter (as far as I know) and have repeated them to be safe.

It seems to be.... A CUBE!

As cool as this looks from far away, its annoying as hell in every other circumstance. Is this a common thing? (I don't suppose it is)

*EDIT*

More experimenting finds the root cause of this to be somewhere in the .DLL's of Environmental Visual Enhancement. I haven't tracked down which .DLL in particular yet.

*EDIT #2*

It seems to be Utils.dll and tied directly with the clouds - when I remove Utils.dll, this cube disappears, as do the clouds themselves. I am at a loss at how to solve this

Edited September 12, 2015 by JJJacksonTyler
ctrl+alt+E, then click "Apply", then ctrl+alt+E again to close the window.

RVE for Linux on my 32bit KSP (3200 x 1800 pics):

Javascript is disabled. View full album

I deleted some cloud layers to lower RAM usage. With Open GL, ATM Basic and much lower amount of parts (300-400mb instead of 700mb on my other install) this is quite playable. It crashes after 60-90 minutes.

Anyone found this bug?

The FOV got messed up as well as the camera controls. Scrolling up zoomed out an scrolling down zoomed in. Also the box thingy. Outside of that the atmo colour is black. After restarting the game though, the bug went away!

Edited September 12, 2015 by pack_rtr

Good afternoon!

I want to say that this is a very nice mode . But, unfortunately, I have a problem . Here are screenshots

Main menu:

On orbit, ALT ~ 900 000 m

Of course, I pressed ALT+E on the launch pad.

Here the list of installed mods in the game

I am used KSP version 1.0.4. Windows 7 64. GeForce GTX 660, 16 Gb RAM. And I used OpenGL.

What did I do wrong? Or you just need to wait for the release mode.

Edited September 13, 2015 by Irenicus

Greetings! I'm trying to put in a launch complex with Kerbal Konstructs, but the water level is so high that it covers Cape Canaveral. How would I go about lowering the water a few meters?

The red stars show where missile row would be. You can see there's also city texture under water.

Greetings! I'm trying to put in a launch complex with Kerbal Konstructs, but the water level is so high that it covers Cape Canaveral. How would I go about lowering the water a few meters?

The red stars show where missile row would be. You can see there's also city texture under water.

http://i.imgur.com/WsZtxPc.png

Hi, As far as I know the water hasn't changed height, there's just a bug where the city textures persist under water, this has been noted to rbray, I'm afraid there's not really anything I can do without his help.

Thanks pingopete. The water probably did not change height. It was probably too high all along. The GPS coordinates of the Cape Canaveral Launch Complexes are under water, and probably always were. I was hoping there was a way to lower the water level. If the issue is that EVE does not have this ability, I'll check the source code and see if I can figure out how it's done, and rewrite that part of the plugin myself. Thanks!

Felbourn, I think that you should report this to NathanKell in the RSS thread and ask for the normal map of Earth to be corrected. This way the ground will be risen in this one point, instead of the water being lowered all around the globe.

Good afternoon!

What did I do wrong? Or you just need to wait for the release mode.

You can't switch to vessels via the tracking center, you have to launch a vehicle and then switch via the map screen.

If you want R-P0 with RVE, you can go to the commit and apply the changes to the areas Nathan did to the contracts, but make sure you have Notepad++ it will make it a ton of easier.

Thx for the reply; I guess it'd be even easier (and more useful) to just grab RP-0 as a whole from Github. NK tends to ship the DLLs in the repo, too.

But my main question was if pingopete would be willing to update his Linux64 branch for RVE itself; I'm sure there were lots of neat things added in the past month that I'd love to tinker around with

You can't switch to vessels via the tracking center, you have to launch a vehicle and then switch via the map screen.

Thank you so much, pingopete!!!

But in the future you will fix that? Because switching to vessels via the tracking center I like see to our Earth

And thank you for NICE mod! Amazing Earth! As real

Thank you so much, pingopete!!!

But in the future you will fix that? Because switching to vessels via the tracking center I like see to our Earth

And thank you for NICE mod! Amazing Earth! As real

Thanks, yeah no it's definitely less than ideal, it's inherent to the current builds of the EVE overhaul and stems from deep within the .dlls which I lack the know-how to tweak sorry
Wait, is there a download link here? I can't seem to find it.
Hey Pete I'm currently finishing up a video I'm working on. It shows off your mod a bit. You don't mind if I use it in my video do you?

Wait, is there a download link here? I can't seem to find it.

lemme know when you find it, can't find it either..

Also, I downloaded ATM Aggresive as well as this but the loading bar still hangs. I'm using KSP 1.0.4 on a MacBook Air running OSX Yosemite.
